chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Marie Bremer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 2, 4 and 5 are read-in and dismissed.
Concurrent with Minnesota Probation and Counts 1, 3 and 6.


 In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation on Count 1 Case #14CF137.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Debrief Law Enforcement within the next 10 days.
-Write letters of apology to Victims within 30 days, letters to Agent.
AODA and follow all treatment/therapy recommendations.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Nicole Marie Bremer appeared. Includes 14CF137, 14CF190 and 14TR1262. There is an agreement. State files an amended INFO. Court reviews felony conviction and constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charges and possible penalties for counts 1 - Posess of Meth, 3 - Take and Drive w/o consent (class H felony) and 6 - Take and Drive w/o consent (class H felony). Def pleads no contest to counts 1, 3 and 6. Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of counts 1, 3 and 6; counts 2, 4 and 5 are read-in and dismissed for restitution purposes. 14CF190 is read-in and dismissed for restitution purposes. Court also dismisses 14TR1262. Sentencing recommendations. Court orders S/W 3 years probation with conditions: 
Concurrent with MN probation and counts 1, 3 and 6 are concurrent. 
*RE: Count one: 1 year in St. Croix County Jail with credit for 139 days time served. No good time
*Restitution as noted on restitution worksheet - Payable through probation. 
*Court costs of $268.00 for each count for a total of $804.00 - Payable through probation. Restitution to be paid first.
*AODA and follow all treatment/therapy recommendations. 
*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*Debrief law enforcement w/in the next 10 days.
*DNA sample and surcharge
*Write letters of apology to victims within 30 days. Letters to be given to probation agent. 
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
Filed by S and L Brink. Re: Case. km
Plea hearing on August 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
